name: Shroud Ghost
description:
18. Shroud Ghost (Pocong)
 in Indonesian lore, Pocong is said to be the soul of a deceased person who is doomed to wander the earth due to unfinished earthly business. It takes the form of a corpse fully wrapped in a burial shroud. Around its neck, arms, and legs are small cloths which are used as ties to bind the shroud to the body; a pocong is essentially a "living' corpse trapped in its own shroud.

a part of my Inktober serial Illustrations titled ‘Indonesian Horror Stories’. 

thank you!

JPG
